entries.description: Icons defined in this icon pack

missing.description: Special icon used when some other icon is not found

CustomIconPackEntry.description: Here specific/custom icons for widgets can be stored.

icon.description: Value is the path to the icon relative to the icon pack folder.

key.description:
we recomend following the widget id + icon name to avoid collisions
 e.g. "@username/widgetid::iconname" but you can use whatever you want

Icon.description: The icon paths in this structure are relative to the icon pack folder.

base.description: Icon to use if no light or dark icon is specified, if both light and dark are specified this can be omitted

dark.description: Alternative icon to use when system theme is dark

isAproximatelySquare.description: Whether the icon is a square or not

light.description: Alternative icon to use when system theme is light

mask.description: Mask to be applied over the icon, themes can use this to apply custom colors over the icon.

ResourceId.description: visual id composed of the creator username and the resource name

description.description: Map of language code to description. Could be a string, mapped to `en`.

appTargetVersion.description:
App target version that this resource is compatible with.\
 Developers are responsible to update the resource so when resource does not
 match the current app version, the resource will be shown with a warning message

banner.description: Banner image with aspect ratio of 21/9, this is used when promoting the resource.

displayName.description: Map of language code to display name. Could be a string, mapped to `en`.

portrait.description: Portrait image with aspect ratio of 1/1

screenshots.description: Screenshots should use aspect ratio of 16/9

tags.description: tags are keywords to be used for searching and indexing

ResourceText.description: Map of language code as key an translated values. Could be a string, mapped to `en`.

SharedIconPackEntry.description: Intended to store file icons by extension

extension.description: File extension without the dot, e.g. "txt"

UniqueIconPackEntry.description:
Key can be user model id, filename or a full path.
 In case of path this should be an executable or a lnk file or any other file that can
 have an unique/individual icon as are the applications, otherwise use `shared`.

path.description:
Path or filename of the application, mostly this should be present,
 but cases like PWAs on Edge can have no path and be only an UMID.

redirect.description:
In case of path be a lnk file this can be set to a different location to use the icon from.
 If present, icon on this entry will be ignored
